The Sandwich Spot's sammies are a cut above. Totally worth $8.95 for a giant and very tasty sandwich. One sandwich was both lunch and dinner for me. Try the Dutch Crunch bread.

I don't believe they could pile any more quality meat along with great toppings and keep the sandwiches together. We split one and it was plenty for a lunch portion. Sourdough bun was perfect as well. Add very cordial folks behind the counter it makes this definitely a great place to patronize.

Was craving a good sandwich and this beyond satisfied that craving. So many options to choose from. I got the DILF and have been wanting another one ever since we left :)

Stopped by for lunch - split a Dvorjak with hubby. Plenty for two - we added chips and a beverage for $1.75. All sandwiches (almost) are $8.49. Tried the Dutch bread. We were not disappointed in anything! Fresh ingredients and staff was happy to split it for us.

What a delicious find in Palm Springs. We had two excellent sandwiches-Miss Molly, a pastrami delight and a turkey with prosciutto. The staff are friendly, helpful, and great sandwich makers. I highly recommend a stop by this fabulous shop.

When you don't want a full lunch meal at a restaurant check out this small, quirky sandwich shop in downtown Palm Springs (off of a side street). Their sandwich choices all sound delicious, so just order one a enjoy like my hubby and I did.

We needed a quick bite to eat and found this place! I had the dirty weekend and my husband had the djokovic. Sandwiches were delicious and the portions were great!

We were happy to find this small sandwich spot in Palm Springs. The sandwiches were delicious (especially the Dutch Crunch rolls!). The service was fast. This is the quintessential burger. Freshly ground meat, sumptuous cheese on a fresh, soft bun, Add frites and/or cole slaw and you are in for a real treat.

this place continues to draw me back with the tasty sliders and the OMG good potato salad. sit outside and people watch love it!

Good food, good service, very clean, friendly, didn't have to wait long for our food. Got seated right away. Would go back.

This place is one of my favorites. Very good casual food, fair prices. The service here is super attentive and the staff are quite friendly. Especially recommend for breakfast!

Had breakfast here before heading to the airport. It was Saturday so very busy. The five of us were seated at a small booth. We should have sat outside as it was also ver noisy inside. The food was good. And they served a complimentary crepe for a birthday we were celebrating.

Too much food! All good! Breakfast! Large portions. Friendly service. We were leaving down and heard about Elmer's. Well worth the visit.

No complaints on the food, service or cleanliness. If you want a reliable place to get those staple breakfast items this is a great spot. And the food was FAST! Pancakes on point and crispy bacon. The line at 9am on a Sunday was long, but the staff was efficient at seating eager customers. Great menu, and love their special pancakes! It's easy to see why Elmer's so popular with locals and visitors.

My wife and I both got eggs benedict which were really good. Has a diner feel, but the food was really good.

The patio is a wonderful place to enjoy drinks and a meal. The Sangria is a definite thirst quencher and the fried chicken is delicious either on a salad or the full fried chicken meal.

Expensive, but worth it for a special occasion. We were there on a very busy Friday (reservations a must). Food and service was absolutely superb, but we felt rushed to eat so the table could be turned.

Stiff drinks, good food and conversation. The A list of Palm Springs locals. Come early for happy hour it fills up fast. Friendly welcoming crowd. A must stop on any tour of the desert.

After giving up on Cheeky's after an hour wait, Tropicale was a bit off the main drag, no waiting and a far better ambiance. Service and food was excellent and we had a terrific large family breakfast.

Bill's Pizza is a very busy restaurant because they make great tasting pizza's for a good price. They have a large pizza menu as well as excellent salads. The staff is very friendly and our little pup was warmly welcomed on their outdoor patio.

Where else can you get an amazing pizza, build your own or off the menu, thin crust, several awesome sauces, a $6 pour of wine and all near $20.

Bill's Pizza is one of the best in Palm Springs. The crust so crisp and tender with the most delicious variety of toppings. As a local and eaten there many times I have never been disappointed in how delicious they taste and I have tried just about everyone on their menu.

Well actually one can top it................and they do with generous toppings on each perfectly baked pie. Don't want a full, fancier sit down meal in Palm Springs? This is a great choice at a modest price point. I imagine virtually any choice or combination is a good one. Ours certainly was.

Excellent Pizza and way too many choices, makes it hard to pick! We sat outside under the heat lamps and enjoyed people watching. This pizza establishment was voted one of the top 10 in the United States and we will be back again next time we visit Palm Springs.

Fresh fresh fresh. The menu is simple but the recipes are complex and worth a wait. The oysters are from the pacific NW and they are as fresh as if you were at the dock. The sauces are just excellent and the soup is grand. On Fridays you can get the best lobster bisque in the valley.

Shrimp enchiladas. Just, wow. Great tortillas, I could eat them on their own.
Not a fancy spot by any means, but fantastic food and very friendly staff.

All of of were very pleased, food was piping hot & tasty, nice salsa bar w/excellent pico de gallo. Service was quick & friendly.

Best Mexican food. Salsa bar is great. Had chorizo and eggs twice here for breakfast. Couldn't wait to come back to Palm Springs so we can eat here. Small place but pleasant. Great personal service. We are coming for dinner tonight.

I had the carne asana plate that was terrific. And I'm rather fussy about the chips at a Mexican restaurant - LOVED the chips here. There's a self-serve salsa bar so everyone can have a the type of salsa that they like.

I have been 3/4 times in the last 4 months, and will go back. Not all Mexican

Casual restaurant in a convenient location with convenient parking. Nice homemade Salsa bar and friendly staff. The Gringo owner, Charlie, often schmoozes the guests and assures satisfaction.

Years of coming down to the valley and I have always been disappointed with the food and the atmosphere of the restaurants, this one could have been transplanted to any great food city, New York, London etc. Long communal tables and booths inside, marvellous patio outside.

Dining with best if friends to celebrate birthdays. Recommend a Palmspringer cocktail if you like pineapple. Pizza, Brussel sprouts, duck fat fries, wood fired chicken and more! Pistachio ice cream to finish the night. Beautifully appointed interior. Excellent service!!

This spot is tucked away but a cool vibe that is worth the stop. The cement architecture is unexpected but fits this place and the food is great. the menu is for the foodie and has a flare of old world charm that made me feel like I was reading a French menu.

This restaurant is one of my favorites, not just in Palm Springs but period. The room is stunning and the food is always creative and delicious. They have an amazing cocktail program. Best meal of the weekend by far in the town. Bar screwed up several of our drinks but service recovery was so good it didn't matter. Really great food, service, and decor. Take your date for a romantic night or go with friends before a big night out. You can't go wrong with this place.

Coffee is amazing and the staff are incredibly friendly. The back area outside is great. I would recommend anyone who travels to Palm Springs tries it. Love this place.

From the courteous young man at the front, service is polished and yet friendly. We like Thursday evenings when a fabulous jazz trio plays in the bar; this...


More  



Dropped in to share a bottle of wine with the wife. Great wine list!! Sat at the bar which is always interesting and fun. Excellent service. After the wine we wanted a small item and the server suggested Vietnamese Spring rolls. I was expecting deep fried. These were uncooked, fresh and delicious!

The patio is a wonderful place to enjoy drinks and a meal. The Sangria is a definite thirst quencher and the fried chicken is delicious either on a salad or the full fried chicken meal.

Expensive, but worth it for a special occasion. We were there on a very busy Friday (reservations a must). Food and service was absolutely superb, but we felt rushed to eat so the table could be turned.

The "cat was let out of the bag" awhile ago so it's not surprising that the popularly of Tropicale has led to packed crowds. If you plan on dining in the dining room or on the patio, reservations are a must. Reservations are not taken for the Coral Seas Lounge. This lovely bar, both inside and outside fills up early....


More  



Stiff drinks, good food and conversation. The A list of Palm Springs locals. Come early for happy hour it fills up fast. Friendly welcoming crowd. A must stop on any tour of the desert.

Good food, good service and a wonderful, sunny, umbrellered (is there such a word?) courtyard to eat at.
After giving up on Cheeky's after an hour wait, Tropicale was a bit off the main drag, no waiting and a far better ambiance. Service and food was excellent and we had a terrific large family breakfast.

The bar menu is the way to go here. Very crowded. Food came to our table long before the drinks. A bit odd. Service is brisk, but rushed and impersonal. I have not ever been a big fan of this place, but it is attractive and popular. It is not relaxing. the bar menu is broad and good. Nothing disappointed.

We always meet here with friends during the winter while we stay in Palm Springs, love the dinner menu with innovative dishes and our favourite is happy hour, Tuesday & Thursday music and Wednesday Happy Hour all night long, delicious Moroccan Lamb Meatballs and Crispy Nori Ahi Tuna are always on our small plate selection. Lovely patio and great service.

Off the main drag of Palm Springs but worth the find. A little dark inside but okay. We went once for drinks and appetizers and they were great. Bacon wrapped dates were delicious!
Returned a couple of nights later for dinner and again we were not disappointed. We opted to sit outside because it was a lovely evening and they...


More

My friends recommended this place for a quick dinner. I told them that I've never been and they were shocked!
Took me in, got a table, and immediately the smells of dough, sauce, cheese, and various toppings overwhelmed me. It smelled absolutely delicious in here.
My friend showed the case of pre-baked pizza where I can order by the slice,...


More  



at the spur of the moment we decided we were hungry and had a little while before atending a movie so we stopped at the very busy and popular bill's pizza and on a friday night to boot! well, it would have taken too long to sit downand order a full pizza with all the things we usually like on...


More  



Bill's Pizza is a very busy restaurant because they make great tasting pizza's for a good price. They have a large pizza menu as well as excellent salads. The staff is very friendly and our little pup was warmly welcomed on their outdoor patio.

Where else can you get an amazing pizza, build your own or off the menu, thin crust, several awesome sauces, a $6 pour of wine and all near $20.

Bill's Pizza is one of the best in Palm Springs. The crust so crisp and tender with the most delicious variety of toppings. As a local and eaten there many times I have never been disappointed in how delicious they taste and I have tried just about everyone on their menu.

Well actually one can top it................and they do with generous toppings on each perfectly baked pie. Don't want a full, fancier sit down meal in Palm Springs? This is a great choice at a modest price point. I imagine virtually any choice or combination is a good one. Ours certainly was.

Excellent Pizza and way too many choices, makes it hard to pick! We sat outside under the heat lamps and enjoyed people watching. This pizza establishment was voted one of the top 10 in the United States and we will be back again next time we visit Palm Springs.

There are just too many great pizza's to choose from when you go to Bills. It almost requires a return visit to try out other flavors. There is indoor and outdoor seating with entire pizzas or by the slice. There is a fair selection of beer and wine choices. Bill's only accepts cash or debit cards and the trip to...


More  



The service is excellent. Refills were fast and food came fast. Pizzas were very good, and somehow the managed to make the crust super delicious. The pizza "Bacon me crazy" was really nice, especially if you like cheese. Will come back.

The pizza crust was excellent. Made like the ones in New York. Great flavor and you can buy by the slice or whole pizza. Must stop while shopping the local area.
title: Bill's Pizza, Palm Springs
address: 119 S Indian Canyon Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92262-6603

review_list:
We enjoy the happy hour at Trio. The apps and drinks are delicious and the service very attentive. We've heard dinner is very good.

The three course meal for about 20.00 is a really great value. They were able to accommodate food allergies. The food was quite delicious. I had the blue cheese burger which was perfectly cooked.

This restaurant is a fave of both visitors as well as us locals. Always great food, good service and great seating outdoors in the open. We love this place! Prime rib is GREAT!

Good prices and a good variety of food. It was quite busy and a little noisy. I was a little disappointed that they only had one local beer on tap.

Was there a week ago. This place used to be awesome. Our server Terry was nice other than that everything was pretty bad. Ordered Calamari as an appetizer but it was the greasiest I ever had. My title says it all!
Inside or outside tables are offered with quick efficient service. Pricing very reasonable.

We had a great evening at this PS hot spot! Excellent service from our waiter & bus boys! Food was excellent! Fried artichokes were to die for! My Steak was cooked to perfection. The portions are quite generous as well. The restaurant is lively and other guests seemed to be enjoying themselves as much as we were. Definitely suggest reservations....

Everything we had was so tasty. Crayfish pot pie was to die for. Great key lime pie. Very attentive service. Extremely noisy, however.

Fabulous restaurant with pricing for the three course dinner surprisingly modest as well as many wine selections. Stopped for breakfast and really enjoyed it. They focus on house made items. Had the pancakes which had fresh corn and buttermilk. Also tried the bacon flight 5 different flavors of bacon, put that in he had to try but once is enough category.

Really over-rated. Very, very popular with the LA crowd so the lines are always long. The food is just so-so. Very original menu, but the execution is not there. Everything tastes bland.

Stopped here for breakfast. They change their menu every week. The bacon is to die for. Ordered key lime waffles. The flavor was delicious.

Dinner here second time around. Food good. We had a new waitress and there were six of us. Restaurant busy...food was slow to arrive. Everyone was pleased with their meal. We eat here often as seasonal residents who live within walking distance. Not fine dining, but comfort food served without a flare. We have eaten here 3 times in the last week. The food is generally good. However,while the helpers are very good the waiters have been awful. The last visit to this restaurant will be our last. Our waiter was condescending and arrogant .

Trip Advisor rarely sends us bad tips. This was one. We went on a Friday evening, got in with only a short wait since we were there early. Staff , service and food GREAT....😋YUM!

I had breakfast two days in a row and enjoyed the pecan sweet rolls both times. They serve a generous amount and I could have shared, but they were too good. The traditional breakfast was excellent. It is near the end of town, but well worth the short drive.

Billy Reed's has been a Palm Springs institution since 1975 and still delivers on its promise of really good food and a warm welcome at reasonable prices.
Billy and Robbie are back in charge after a hiatus and have made BR's wonderfully homey and delicious. The pot roast is tasty, the shrimp remind me of my youth and the service...

We went for breakfast and I had the Billy Reed rib eye and eggs, it was soooo good that we went the next day for dinner and had the Billy Reeb rib eye for dinner, it was the best rib eye steak I have ever had! Also the Restaurant had great ambiance, you have to try it!

Good comfort foods, large portions and good service. It has a cozy, old-fashion décor. Avocado Chicken Curry salad was excellent and very large so there was enough for a lunch the next day. Prices reasonable.
title: Billy Reed's Restaurant, Palm Springs

review_list:
Was there two weeks ago and the food was really good as well as the atmosphere.
Our server had a very large table outside so our service was a bit slow. However the manager and others took care of everything. It is a fine dining place and good for a romantic evening.

We sat indoors. Service was good even though we sat adjacent to a large dinner party. Nice ambiance. Free valet. Had the beef filet with an exquisite wine sauce. The meal was pricey but worth it. For dessert I recommend the Basil Lavender Scented Pound Cake. Went gambling afterwards. Won.

Husband and I wandered over for dinner one night and were pleasantly surprised. We were seated in a lovely patio/garden area under a few heaters and had a delightful dinner. We even got dessert (which we never do) - DIVINE (I think it was the chocolate peanut butter dish). Highly recommend for a couple wanting to enjoy each others company...


More  



Enjoyable evening with friends at this classic Palm Springs restaurant. Once a portion of the Cary Grant estate and now a fun and thoroughly enjoyable stage for culinary pleasure.

The setting is exquisite -- Cary Grant's former casa/estate -- beautiful garden entry and the inside dining area is fabulous. The wait/serving staff was impeccable. Suggestions were good - lots of information and opinions. Cocktail/wine service was very good.
All in all, a spectacular evening!!!

We popped in for cocktails and ended up ordering from the bar menu, great fish & chips nicely presented and then got persuaded to try the sticky toff pudding, excellent, wanted more. Sadly a very small bar area in a lovely setting of the Late Cary Grant Estate, too bad they did not dedicate more to a bar - happy...

This restaurant was suggested to us by a host at the PSTC's on-site restaurant. The potato, leek and parsnip soup: superb; duck breast: superb; barramundi: superb. For desserts, we thoroughly enjoyed the sticky pudding and the soufflé. The basil lavender scented pound cake wasn't as much of a hit with us, and I didn't really care for the mango sorbet...

The setting is beautiful. The service cannot be better. The food is fresh, innovative, presented beautifully and full of flavor.

We went to Copley's the previous year and really enjoyed the service and delicious food sitting out doors on the patio which is very lovely, but this year the food and service were seriously bad. Really lovely dinner, service and setting. We had salmon and barramundi, a Haymaker Sav Blan wine, and split a creme brûlée. Yum Yum Yum No wonder the locals love this place.

Good food, reasonable prices, wonderful service! An extensive breakfast menu on which most people will find the perfect meal.

Rick's has been here for years and has become a bit iconic and a "go to" place for breakfast in Palm Springs, particularly if you like "greasy spoon" types of breakfast. A nice restaurant for breakfast (and lunch?). Service was quick and pleasant, and it was well frequented by locals

Went for breakfast found it a little pricy but the food was good. No small sized/calorie meals. Good point - they have Cuban coffee and Cuban lunch menu items.

I visited for lunch. Almost empty. The salmon salad was good. Service however was poor with the server trying to be smartie. Place needs update but is nice enough with big windows. Mens bathroom needs cleaning/remodeling. There are better places to eat oin Palm Springs.

Great quality food. Service was very slow and without much pleasantry but the quality of the ingredients made up for it. Perhaps just be careful not to ride on the back of that forever and make a little more effort to be pleasant to new guests even if they aren't your friends/regulars ?
Nice meal all told

Perfect diner experience with great service, bottomless coffee and solid food.

Excellent food, lovely atmosphere. Superb Milkshakes! Friendly, helpful staff. If you like the 1950's and burgers it's a great place.

I really enjoyed Ruby's, it's a really cool and fun venue. The staff were friendly and attentive and the food was very tasty!
We got burgers, fries and milkshakes which I would recommend the anyone.

Ruby's has very good burgers as well as onion rings and 5 different kinds of French fries.....the kids enjoyed the 'kids' activity of building a paper 1950's type car....and as stated above, they ate free...what more could you want?

Stopped in for lunch, service was a little off but they made up for it. Had a great sandwich and fries. Nice little lunch and great atmosphere for a diner.

Right in the heart of town, this is a great option for a meal. It's got a great theme, and the food is excellent. Large potions and well priced. The waiter we had was amazing, a real character! We went to Ruby's Diner every morning during our 3-night stay in Palm Springs as our hotel gave us a coupon.

Extremely well-located diner in Palm Springs to enjoy a casual meal with a menu that has something for everyone. Located on main street and convenient to shopping! Wonderful service, delicious burgers and shakes brought us back to Ruby's a couple of times during our week's stay in Palm Springs. The banana caramel shake was too yummy, and one serving refilled the glass another time. Server was more than happy to split the burger so we could share. Thank goodness. Fun ambience from the 50's.

When my Dad came for a visit to Southern California we drove him to Palm Springs and went straight to Ruby's for a burger. It was delicious and we enjoyed eating out on the patio.

Diner decor with a diner menu. Simple fare in a central location. Good burgers and shakes. Good service.

We had great food at this place. Of the dozen eateries we dined at during this trip, Sammy's is the only one we went to twice. Authentic food in a great atmosphere. The tapenade was great. Give this one a try.

I tried their "World famous" fish tacos and they were good but the cream sauce was bland and as we're the toppings. My wife enjoyed the fish and chips. The fries were good but they are a little skimpy with them for the price you pay for a meal.

My wife had the shrimp taco lunch special and I had the healthy meal. The wait staff was very efficient and made our meal very enjoyable. We will definitely go back again, I want the scallops meal and my wife wants another shrimp taco.

My husband and I discovered this burger joint that has terrific jazz every night. We had jalapeño burgers, blue cheese burgers, onion rings, fries and beer. All yummy. They also have wine and other beverages. You can always sit at the counter out front and just get a burger, but plan a night to hear some great music. Be sure...


More  



If you are looking for a great burger and really great fries this is the place to go! The burger is juicy and the staff are very attentive. Live music in the evening in the back room of the restaurant. No fluff on the decor but come for the food, old school counter dining and leave full and happy.

Small home in the wall place but well worth it. The front part is small but they were able accommodate a party of 15 in the back room where the live music was going to be. Normally tables in there have to be reserved but they made room for our large party. The band was setting up when we sat...


More  



Early this month we heard Rose Malet, a jazz singer, so were excited to hear her again. This time in Woody's Burgers, a causal dining experience, but with great food. Rose made it extra special. Be sure to get a reservation as the place fills up fast.

Always a must especially on Fridays to take in Rose's show in the back room
Love the Blue Berger and great prices

We enjoyed a delightful evening listening to music and song with Trish Hatley and Barney McClure at Woody's! While alcohol is served, we opted for milk shakes and fries and were not disappointed. We enjoyed so much we went back a few days later and tried their burgers - delicious!!! Counter service or tables. Live entertainment 7 nights a week....


More  



Really enjoyed an evening of burgers and music. Basic menu but everything we had was excellent. Busy for a Monday night and the staff was a little stressed but the service was still good.
Don't be fooled by the shake shop appearance from the road... There's a dining room in back with music every evening.
Go try it for yourself!

So good! Hole in the wall type place but worth coming to! My husband and I both got the sliders. You're able to pick any three burgers from the menu and get them as sliders. All great! Really friendly staff also.

Well this place is average at best the food is average the French fries is the best thing I tasted but on a positive note they do have live entertainment every night of the week so come check it
title: Woody's Burgers, Palm Springs

review_list:
This place was recommended by friends. Wow! The menus is extensive, but not expensive. The staff is friendly, service excellent, and the food is superb. The location on N.Palm Canyon is an easy walk from our condo. We will definitely be returning.

The staff was friendly and accommodating. I ate there 2 separate times and the food was great. They had terrific sweet potato wedges which I like with honey. The waiter didn't skimp on my request

My only problem with Rick's is that the lechon is SO good that I can't even think about ordering anything else. Maybe one day, if I ever get tired of ordering the same thing repeatedly-- but I can't imagine that. Five of us decided on a late lunch here. We met shortly after one so the was plenty of room. We hadn't all gotten together in months and we expected a long visit. The place suited us perfectly. Not exactly white tablecloth, but much more upscale in ambiance, service and menu then the very popular Rick's Restaurant down the street. This Cuban restaurant serves fantastic Cuban food and the servers are so helpful! You must try this establishment. No one in our party of 4 was disappointed! Many clearly marked vegan and gluten free offerings.

Rick Seidner’s opened his first popular breakfast and lunch spot over 28 years ago. Now at his second Palm Canyon location, Rick’s Desert Grill, he expands to dinner service offering classic, satisfying Cuban American food and cocktails such as Arroz con Pollo, Sweet Plantains and Mojitos.

Newest extension for Rick's Restaurant group in Palm Springs. Dinner only with Full bar service. MENU is generic with Cuban flare. Medium priced and generally good service. Parking is available but lot can fill up quickly. Busy season is,January thru April.
title: Rick's Desert Grill, Palm Springs

I caught this place out of the corner of my eye while driving by. I am so glad I stopped in. We absolutely love dining at R&O's. As regulars enjoyed many items on the menu. We always like sitting at the oytster bar and enjoy the banter. Ruben or Ozzy will accommodate special requests and make you laugh in the process. EAT HERE AND YOU'LL BE BACK!!!

Very good food and service. Clean establishment. Had to heaters on outside as it was a little chilly.

Fresh fresh fresh. The menu is simple but the recipes are complex and worth a wait. The oysters are from the pacific NW and they are as fresh as if you were at the dock. The sauces are just excellent and the soup is grand. On Fridays you can get the best lobster bisque in the valley.

We were visiting Andreas Canyon and stoped in for some light lunch. I had a fried oyster taco and a salad. This was a great choice. It was 1:00 in the afternoon and they were busy. We enjoyed our visit.

I ordered shrimp tacos and specifically asked for very light condiments. Instead the first time brought they were drowned in it. I watched him dress the shrimp with tons of sauce. Not light at all. They didn't seem to really care. Charged me full price despite unhappiness. Last trip.

I hope we stopped here on an off nite. Stopped by on a late afternoon. No crowd at all. It took awhile for the waitress to come by to take our drink order, and another long wait to return with our drinks and take our food order.

Staying in P. S. for a long weekend getaway. We decided on Ruban and Ozzy's. Fried oyster taco was excellent. So good my husband and I ordered a second round.

We love oysters and it's hard to imagine, but Ruben & Ozzy's serves up some of the best oysters we've had in several different states. Stay away! The guacamole is the best we've had anywhere. Made fresh right at your table, you want to eat this stuff with a spoon! Everything we've had here is delicious, but the guac is special.

Situated just off the main restaurant area in downtown Palm Springs , this place offers very good food in an rather old setting. Staff is really nice. There are better places in town for Mexican but this is a solid choice.

We stopped in Palm Springs as an overnight on a cross country move and ate dinner here. We have spent the last 6 years in central Texas and I have to say, the quality and authenticity of this food exceeds what we've been eating there. Nice atmosphere and service!

I found the atmosphere a little too dark and boring. It IS loud inside the restaurant because of all the hard surfaces...so if you don't want to dine amid a cacophony chose to be seated on the outside patio. Fantastic food! Don't consider having the mole unless you're willing to fall in love! I don't even like mole, but HOLY MOLE this stuff was awesome. Great staff and margaritas, too! Oh, and you must have the chile desnudos appetizer! Love!

We went for Sunday brunch and the drag show. Yes, a drag show. And most of those "girls" we're way better looking than I am!! Wow! What a show!! The food was really good and the margaritas were delicious! Bring dollar bills for tips. Oh, and make a reservation for sure. Ask specifically for a table instead of a booth.

Don't eat at the obvious place on the main drag downtown. Go find this place and ignore the decor. We had such a blast here.. The food was amazing and the Margaritas did their job!! Great location and very friendly staff... We were actually here a year ago and just had to come back..

Great green sauce and salsa bar at this little hole in the wall in a strip mall venue. We enjoyed all the food there as well as pleasant service. I would definitely go back.

Very tasty enchiladas verde. Good portions too. A salsa bar with many choices. Feels like a good place to get good authentic Mexican food.

Shrimp enchiladas. Just, wow. Great tortillas, I could eat them on their own.
Not a fancy spot by any means, but fantastic food and very friendly staff.

My family of three ate lunch here, after seeing the good reviews. We weren't disappointed, but weren't "wow-ed" either. Its located down the street from Alberston's, so a bit out of the way if you're downtown. The outdoor patio was pleasant, and the service was moderately quick. The chicken taquito platter was the perfect size for a light lunch. The...

This place was awesome. Great, simple Mexican food. My husband declared his Chorizo breakfast burrito the best burrito he's ever had. Chicken tacos and enchiladas were awesome as well. Really friendly service - we even met Loco Charlie himself! Our only regret is we only got to visit one time. This place deserves it's number 4 rating!

Surprising to find Mexican food this good in a strip mall (near Albertsons). Got the taco sampler plate, wife got the albondigas soup, & a taco, son tries the loco bowl w/carnitas. All of of were very pleased, food was piping hot & tasty, nice salsa bar w/excellent pico de gallo. Service was quick & friendly.

Best Mexican food. Salsa bar is great. Had chorizo and eggs twice here for breakfast. Couldn't wait to come back to Palm Springs so we can eat here. Small place but pleasant. Great personal service. We are coming for dinner tonight.

I had the carne asana plate that was terrific. And I'm rather fussy about the chips at a Mexican restaurant - LOVED the chips here. There's a self-serve salsa bar so everyone can have a the type of salsa that they like.

I have been 3/4 times in the last 4 months, and will go back. Not all Mexican
Restaurants offer ground beef Tacos but they do and very good.

Casual restaurant in a convenient location with convenient parking. Nice homemade Salsa bar and friendly staff. The Gringo owner, Charlie, often schmoozes the guests and assures satisfaction.

review_list:
Wine is only $3 a glass during happy hour which goes to 7pm and the food is fresh, plentiful and delicious. The service is great and it's a busy place with good atmosphere.

The service was good, not spectacular, and the portions for the lunch meals were large. I had the Almond Joy and my wife had her favorite beef with broccoli. We would order both again. For desert we had the Mango with Sticky Rice and it was not just very good but very big. We would go there again.

I don't think they have decided whether they're a Thai restaurant or. Chinese one. The Thai dishes were strangely Chinese flavored. Chinese dishes were just ok. Other than that, the service was very prompt & pleasant.

Very nice late lunch. Incredibly friendly and efficient staff and delicious food. Good portion size and nicely seasoned.

My wife and I went here for dinner and it did not disappoint. It's located in an upscale location yet the prices were very reasonable. We had Pad Thai and a curry dish and both were great. Very good fresh thai food...liked them better when they were in the old smaller location in Palm Desert. Stick with beer, cocktails were a disappointment. Will try the new Palm Desert location.

We always visit during our winter stays in palm Springs, we are spoilt with Asian Food coming from BC but this never dissapoints

Thai Smile is a find. Extensive menu with great Thai food options. Fish lovers (like me) will be quite happy eating here. And for those who like their food "spicy hot" (like me) -- go for it!!!

The new location has very challenging parking. We were were parked outside for not even 10 minutes waiting for our take out and did not learn of our parking surprise till we returned back to Canada. Hot and sour soup is outrageously delicious! Go for the lunch specials - a very good value and the food is always first rate. Excellent service always!

The waiter and waitress made some really great suggestions, the food was tasty and had great portions. The place was lively and everyone seemed to be having as good a time as us.

If you like great Mexican food with huge portions and rich sauces, El Mirasol is for you! My partner and I love Mexican food but can't find anything good in our home town. The Tamales were my personal favourite and so was the fish-bowl sized Margaritas (a must for any visit to El Mirasol!).

Good Margaritas but everything else was flavourless and underwhelming.
We are very puzzled at all of the positive reviews, keep running Forest!

Nothing bad, just nothing great. Food is predictable (always good, just not earth shattering) but prices are more than fair too!

I forgot the name of my dish, but it was the real spicy shrimp dish and it was so flavorful and spicy. Our waiter was extra friendly (which seems to be rare in California)

Last season we never quite made it to El Mirasol, so we really made an effort in our first days here this year. We've already gone back! And will again before we go back East.
The tamales are superb, the chile relleños are zesty (but not too much so); the chicharon is exemplary.
Treat yourself.

on each trip we save one night for El Mirasol and one other place. The staff and consistent food quality make it a keeper for sure. Be ready for a wait on busy nights as this is a locals fav as well

We wondered in and grabbed a few drinks at the bar. They were fantastic. Unfortunately the menu was a little too far out of our comfort zone (we aren't foodies) so we didn't stay for anything else. Very cool atmosphere and looks like its a great place for larger groups.

We had dinner with friends. Ordered small plates. Excellent service. Very expensive wine menu. Good martini.
Overall, the tastes are very intense. Maybe they try to do too much with each dish. Some were very good. More salt than I would prefer.
I like the aspiration. Maybe if we had ordered differently we would have had a better balance.

We wanted to try this restaurant. It is a hard surface restaurant, lots of concrete but the seats are soft. The menu was a brunch menu, I assume. The enchiladas were tasty. The green sauce was very good. My husband had the Lobster Burrito. He enjoyed it. The menu had lots of interesting items.

Years of coming down to the valley and I have always been disappointed with the food and the atmosphere of the restaurants, this one could have been transplanted to any great food city, New York, London etc. Long communal tables and booths inside, marvellous patio outside.

Dining with best if friends to celebrate birthdays. Recommend a Palmspringer cocktail if you like pineapple. Pizza, Brussel sprouts, duck fat fries, wood fired chicken and more! Pistachio ice cream to finish the night. Beautifully appointed interior. Excellent service!!

This spot is tucked away but a cool vibe that is worth the stop. The cement architecture is unexpected but fits this place and the food is great. the menu is for the foodie and has a flare of old world charm that made me feel like I was reading a French menu.

The obligatory heat lamps keep you nice and warm on the patio. We only tried the goat cheese cheesecake and chocolate dessert. Both were good. Everyone there was friendly.

This restaurant is one of my favorites, not just in Palm Springs but period. The room is stunning and the food is always creative and delicious. They have an amazing cocktail program. It should be a must for any visit to Palm Springs. Of the three nights we were in Palm Springs - we ate there twice. It's that good.

Best meal of the weekend by far in the town. Bar screwed up several of our drinks but service recovery was so good it didn't matter. Really great food, service, and decor. Take your date for a romantic night or go with friends before a big night out. You can't go wrong with this place.

Staff is great and efficient. Not a long wait even when crowded. Outside courtyard seatin is great. Really enjoyed and Will go back.

Friendly staff and excellent coffee drinks plus pastry they make. Good outdoor area as well as inside space. Best in the valley.

The coffee here is awesome, whether you want a light roast or something more intense. The lines can be long but the staff is friendly and worth the wait. I always make a stop here when I go to P.S. Lots of eye candy, too ;)

Good coffee shop. Friendly staff and some really food coconut pineapple muffins. There is a nice outdoor seating separated from traffic as well as indoor.

The drinks are great, many good choices, good service (but it's busy so it can take a while!). The breakfast egg sandwiches were pretty good, and the baked goods are high quality.

Koffi is the go-to place for coffee, tea, hot chocolate or other treats, either to meet friends or to pass some time by yourself in Uptown Palm Springs. The garden is a delight.

We love espresso but found theirs to be almost sour rather than bitter. I actually threw mine in the garbage rather than drink it. Just not my taste.

Coffee is amazing and the staff are incredibly friendly. The back area outside is great. I would recommend anyone who travels to Palm Springs tries it. Love this place.

Koffi is the best local coffee bar in the valley. It currently has 3 locations on 111. It roasts and packages its own coffee for local restos that you can also purchase for home brew. Found this on Trip Adviser when we were driving and looking for a light lunch. Had the Big Beak Wrap with roasted chicken and fresh veggies in a wheat tortilla. Came with a side and a dipping sauce. We split it and it was plenty to eat.

Menu is full of healthy options with fairly broad selection. I had a rice wrap filled with quinoa, sweet potatoes, tomatoes, lettuce and more. I loved it!

We ate at Palm Greens 3 times during our stay in January 2016. We especially liked it because we needed to feed both vegetarians and carnivores and the extensive menu at Palm Greens allows for both.
The salad sampler offers the best of Pam Greens. The eggless egg salad (curried tofu!) and broccoli cole slaw are excellent, light and fresh....

Tasteless and overpriced...I've had much better food at corner convenience stores. Eat before you go up the mountain.

Bring warm clothing as it is chilly up there even when 114 back in town. Views worth breath taking but it was quite windy as well. Also bring good walking shoes and plan to arrive early for a hike off the beaten path.

Wonderful place the trip up was fantastic by cable car, The drive up is very steep, (but you not aware of it but coming down you will)

Dining with best if friends to celebrate birthdays. Recommend a Palmspringer cocktail if you like pineapple. Pizza, Brussel sprouts, duck fat fries, wood fired chicken and more! Pistachio ice cream to finish the night. Beautifully appointed interior. Excellent service!!

This spot is tucked away but a cool vibe that is worth the stop. The cement architecture is unexpected but fits this place and the food is great. the menu is for the foodie and has a flare of old world charm that made me feel like I was reading a French menu.

This restaurant is one of my favorites, not just in Palm Springs but period. The room is stunning and the food is always creative and delicious. They have an amazing cocktail program. Best meal of the weekend by far in the town. Bar screwed up several of our drinks but service recovery was so good it didn't matter. Really great food, service, and decor. Take your date for a romantic night or go with friends before a big night out. You can't go wrong with this place.

We had heard America did not "do" Thai...this was fabulous. There were a few strange dishes but the Tom Yum was delicious as was the Panang Curry! We highly recommend it!!

My family was looking for a nice combination of choices for Thai food and we found it here. Tofu and vegetables were excellent and full of rich flavor. We ordered take out to enjoy the meal in our resort and were very pleased with how quick and pleasurable it was to order and eat in a short wait period.

Husband and I came to Palms Springs for a long weekend. We were looking for a casual low key place and found this great place. The service was great and the food equally as good. My duck curry was wonderful.

We wanted good, warm, flavorful food that we and the kids could be happy with. Everything was good. There were no desserts though. Just starchy plantains and coconut ice cream.

Great lunch specials, fresh food cooked to order, outstanding curries and great satay. A must visit. Try the yellow curry it is wonderful. Great lunch specials.

If you want delicious and authentic food, this is the place to be. Nice sized portions, made at the spice level you desire.

Really good Thai at a reasonable price. Extensive menu. Coconut milk soup was very good. Apps and main dishes also very good. I had spring rolls and tofu yellow curry. My favorite. A little warm on the day we were there possibly because it was an unexpected warm day in April.

Enjoyed some take out from Chada last night. The tom yum soup was flavourful but lacked in texture a bit. Really enjoyed the Thai green curry over steamed rice and the pad thai was pretty good too. Overall - don't overlook the north end of town for food choices when in Palm Springs!

OK, it seems nice and clean, but there was a long hair in my dinner, and it sure wasn't mine.
I won't be back.

If there is a problem with anything they will correct it without hesitation.

good food and value. everything was just fine here. very reasonable prices and service was pretty good as well.

Great food at a fair price. Love the place, and always find great service at Denny's across the country.

Excellent simple food, we'll prepared, by friendly people. Try the chicken bowl with brown rice. It's enough for two people and under $10! I hear the chili dog is awesome, but I haven't tried it. It's really a take out place, but they do have counter inside and a couple of small outside tables.

Great fast food and service excellent - very friendly and welcoming. Kids loved it too! Excellent vallue for money.

Tasteless and overpriced...I've had much better food at corner convenience stores. Eat before you go up the mountain.

Good Margaritas but everything else was flavourless and underwhelming.
We are very puzzled at all of the positive reviews, keep running Forest!

Treat yourself.

We wanted to try this restaurant. It is a hard surface restaurant, lots of concrete but the seats are soft. The menu was a brunch menu, I assume. The enchiladas were tasty. The green sauce was very good. My husband had the Lobster Burrito. He enjoyed it. The menu had lots of interesting items.

Years of coming down to the valley and I have always been disappointed with the food and the atmosphere of the restaurants, this one could have been transplanted to any great food city, New York, London etc. Long communal tables and booths inside, marvellous patio outside.

Dining with best if friends to celebrate birthdays. Recommend a Palmspringer cocktail if you like pineapple. Pizza, Brussel sprouts, duck fat fries, wood fired chicken and more! Pistachio ice cream to finish the night. Beautifully appointed interior. Excellent service!!

This spot is tucked away but a cool vibe that is worth the stop. The cement architecture is unexpected but fits this place and the food is great. the menu is for the foodie and has a flare of old world charm that made me feel like I was reading a French menu.

The obligatory heat lamps keep you nice and warm on the patio. We only tried the goat cheese cheesecake and chocolate dessert. Both were good. Everyone there was friendly.

This restaurant is one of my favorites, not just in Palm Springs but period. The room is stunning and the food is always creative and delicious. They have an amazing cocktail program. It should be a must for any visit to Palm Springs. Of the three nights we were in Palm Springs - we ate there twice. It's that good.

Best meal of the weekend by far in the town. Bar screwed up several of our drinks but service recovery was so good it didn't matter. Really great food, service, and decor. Take your date for a romantic night or go with friends before a big night out. You can't go wrong with this place.

Coffee is amazing and the staff are incredibly friendly. The back area outside is great. I would recommend anyone who travels to Palm Springs tries it. Love this place.
